data.title: Provide a way of playing/queueing silence.
Minimal Sleep during Movie Playback
Missing modules when importing
data.body:
Hi,

I'm working on a game for which I'd like to import pySerial to communicate with an Arduino at certain points. When I import serial, it complains:

```
ImportError: No module named termios
```

I experienced a similar dependency error when importing another module (Queue, I think it was) earlier on when trying out Ren'Py. I know that ultimately I might be pushing beyond the scope of the engine, but I was just wondering how easy it would be to work around something like this.

Loving everything else about the engine so far. Bravo.

data.body: Ren'py fails to build from source on Big-endian architectures due to a missing semicolon in module/IMG_savepng.c.

data.title: Replacing deprecated ffmpeg macros and functionality
data.body:
Hi,

with the upcoming release of ffmpeg 2.9/3.0 Ren'Py will fail to build from source due to the use of deprecated macros and functionality.  This patch fixes these issues and also works with the current version of ffmpeg.  See also the corresponding Debian bug reports for further information.

https://bugs.debian.org/758365
https://bugs.debian.org/803858

data.title: On release, make sure we link the correct pygame_sdl2.
Make TTS text localizable.
Add 'mixer <mixer> mute' and 'mixer <mixer> volume' Preference values.
data.body: These values allow you to operate the mute and volume preferences on any channel instead of only the pre-defined ones in the Preference screen action.

data.title: Add {alpha} text tag.
data.body:
This text tag can be used to just control the opacity of the affected text.

It takes a value between 0.0 and 1.0, corresponding to invisible to fully opaque, respectively. Values can optionally be prefixed by + or - to indicate a change in opacity, as opposed to a total replacement.

data.title: Can't Ren'py recognize a filename begin with numbers?
data.body:
I'm using "config.automatic_images = [ '/' ]" and "config.automatic_images_strip = [ '/' ]" configuration variable in my project. But I found Ren'py cannot show some image because those files have filenames begin with numbers, like:
ch1c/01ayua02m01.png

Then when I'm using "show ch1c 01ayua02m01", Ren'py shows nothing on the screen. But after rename the file and let the filename begin with letters, it works normally.
I'm confusing about whether Ren'py cannot recognize those file which filename begin with numbers. Can it be fixed?

data.title: Disable entering the save screen in replay mode. (Different default screen?)
Hope can realize these functions
data.body:
I'm writing scripts like this:
show bg2 is_ecg01a_s02 as top
with Dis
play sound "vo1/ayumu_10001.ogg"

show bg2 is_ecg01a_s03 as top
with Dis
play sound "vo1/ayumu_10002.ogg"

Here I want image can wait for voice(played by "play" statement) to finish because every voices is related with images. But now, those images can only show continuously. I don't want to use "pause" statement because every voices has different length, it's too ineffective to figure out all the number and I have a plenty of them.
In another engine like BURIKO General Interpreter, I can realize this by writing like this:
IS_ECG01A_s02
_DrawBS
AYUMU_10001
_PlayVoice
_WaitToFinishVoice  // This is the key point! Image will wait for the voice to finish.
_Wait  // This statement in Ren'py is "pause 1"
So I hope Ren'py can add a statement like this, then I can control the play time easily.
————————————————————————
I hope Ren'py can add a configureation which can play a voice when entering the main menu. I know I can set the music in main menu, but I also want to play a voice(like there's a character saying the title of the game) whenever I enter the main menu. It's better if I can set multiple files and Ren'py will play them randomly or one of them by player settings.
————————————————————————
Also, I hope Ren'py can add a statement which can delay audio play. For example, I write script like this:
play sound "vo1/ayumu_10001.ogg" delay 3
show bg2 is_ecg01a_s02
with dissolve

Then the image will show immediately but the audio will play after 3sec. I think it's useful when I don't want to use "pause" in some cases.

data.title: Fixed Drag.snap() animation to use delay
data.body:
Passing a delay argument to Drag.snap() doesn't work, with the snap being instantaneous.  The cause of this seems to be the condition for deciding the snap is over: `if at >= (self.target_at - self.at)` , which is going to be true almost all the time.  So I changed it to what it looked like it should have been, `at >= self.target_at` .

That exposed another problem, which is that snap() doesn't account for the last render time stored in `self.at` being potentially out of date.  E.g., if the drag is moved and then held still without being dropped for 3 seconds, then dropped, any snap called in the drop handlers will see `self.at` as three seconds prior because there have been no calls to render() since the drag stopped moving.
So I added another property, `target_at_delay`, that tells the next render (which has an up-to-date `at` passed to it) to calculate the correct `target_at` and start the animation.  snap() already calls redraw(self,0) so that should be immediate.
